intro: Cartonema trigonospermum, commonly known as the three-seed box, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a small shrub or perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. The fruit is a three-lobed capsule that splits open to release the seeds.
